bug.short_desc: [log view] log file view in debug mode

long_desc.thetext: Many plugin or RCP exception are dumped into the log file (using Plugin.getLog().log()), instead of causing the debugger to pause at the location when the exception occurs. Currently, I have to open/refresh the log file using a text editor (emacs), scroll to the last log item, and find the location of the exception, then switch back to Eclipse and find the location manually. It would be very helpful if Eclipse PDE can provide a log file view for the current plugin/RCP under debug, and automatically (or by one-button click) refresh the log, and locate the source code when the user double click on the line of text in the log (using class-name:line-number extracted from the line).

I thought we had a bug around here asking to view the log from a runtime workbench, but I can't find it. What I did find is a similar request to automatically open a class based on an entry in the log, bug 205561. I am not going to mark this as a duplicate since as of right now, I can't find any past request to view the log from a self hosted runtime workbench.
Also note that the "Java Stack Trace Console" allows you to copy/paste a stack trace into a console, and then navigate the stack trace via hyperlinks (to see associated source code).
